channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tipped fridge freezer, 30th January
item.description:
Upright fridge freezer on verge near pedestrian crossing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 280, Gloucester Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two blocked drains, 30th January
item.description:
Located at entrance to Sudeley Castle - two drains side by side one is pouring water down the hill despite no significant rain for quite a few days and the other immediately adjacent is completely blocked. The water flowing down the hill recently froze and for several days made the hill very dangerous with black ice

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rushley Lane, Sudeley, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light is permanently out problem, 30th January
item.description:
All the new lights went on the first night however the setting in of the final overall control box post, facing number 21, has resulted in that lamppost working and others not. This obviously creating unsafe passage for pedestrians.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole\crater. This is getting much worse and is dangerous for motorcycle users., 30th January
item.description:
Deep pothole in lane 1. Deep enough to damage car wheels.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 30th January
item.description:
FMS rcvd 25.01.24 - Broken branch. Opposite flats. Tree branch broken and could fall onto pedestrians. Side with green fence.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pothole on edge of road, 30th January
item.description:
Edge of road opposite the Industrial works. Looks as if a Lorry has swung too wide when entering the works and its wheel has goune onto the verge causing a seep long pothole right at the edge of the tarmac. Tarmac retains a sharp edge so could be damaging to car tyres.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashchurch Rural, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 30th January
item.description:
Trees Causing damage/obstruction to pavement/road Tree and hedgerow trimming has recently taken place
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 30th January
item.description:
Customer reported ongoing issues with long vehicles/ smaller lorries turning onto Chandos Street from North Street. Roads are too narrow for lorries and long vehicles. They continually get stuck, graze against side of house and break windowsills. There was a bollard to the side of the house but it was situated in a place where it was invisible to drivers until they had already made the turning. Please can something be done about this, it's causing damage to cars and houses. Signage is inadequate as it doesn't say 'no long vehicles'. Also very unsafe for foot traffic.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road closed signs when road is not closed and no roadworks, 30th January
item.description:
Castle Street/Sudeley Hill

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Castle Street, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown debris and soil renders the pavement very narrow and dangerous as fast traffic is only a foot away from pedestrians. Impassable for pushchairs. Totally unsafe for children to use., 30th January
item.description:
The stretch of pavement between Gotherington Garage and the lay-by outside Bishops Cleeve is particularly narrow. The next stretch to Nortenham allotments is poor. Then there is no pavement along the A435 for 200m or so. The pavement is unusable because it means pedestrians have to walk in single file very very close to the kerb.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Damaged tarmac approx 2 to 3 ft a ross, 30th January
